Reviews.Title: “great choice in the south end of town”
Reviews.Author: ndon70
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the sian kaan. Room 203 on the 2nd floor overlooked the quiet courtyard pool, cenote, tree wing building and breakfast area. Located a half block to the beach and 5th avenue, I found the property to be private, quiet and convenient. Due to the construction on 10th avenue, the driver had to park a couple blocks away but a short walk to the hotel was a breeze. Checking in and out was quick and painless. Jose was very welcoming, informative and sets an excellent standard for the hotel. I ended up extended my stay. The ladies at the front desk were great as well. The room was fairly large and modern. The endless supply of extremely hot water was a plus. The sun deck on the roof top was an excellent place to get some sun and absorb the panoramic view of the beach. The hotel offers complimentary continental breakfast and beach towels. Also, free wifi at the breakfast area and pool. Although I did not get a chance to try the breakfast, I saw the same faces enjoying their meals in passing. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis near the hustle and bustle”
Reviews.Author: ZsoltBudapest
Reviews.Content: Originally booked a room for 2 nights and ended staying about 1 week. Hotel: Very good location. On calle 2, between 5th avenue ('the main') and the beach. Only a two minute walk from the bus terminal.(practical for those travelling by bus from/to Cancun/Airport) and a five minute walk from the Ferry to Cozumel (good for day trip). Pool is small but other than for kids, not sure who would want to spend time in or around it instead of lounging on the beach. Premises are relatively quiet. Expect some noise during the day (nothing out of the ordinary) but it gets quiet in the evening (maybe a little too quiet for those looking for entertainment - thankfully 12th street with all the bars is not too far away). Rooms: Decent size and clean. Water pressure is hit and miss but this is only relatively inconvenient. Beds are a little stiff but still comfortable. Services: very good, although service at breakfast can be very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...average Posada”
Reviews.Author: jmolina11
Reviews.Content: The best of Playa del Carmen is to have a beach day and a night walking on Fifth Avenue. This is a nice boulevard with some kind of magic of people from different parts of the world walking around in a relaxed environment surrounded by different kind of restaurants, shops and night places. Therefore you want to be in a hotel close to the beach and close to the avenue. It is not easy to find a good hotel with a good price. My wife and I stayed some days in Cancun but we also wanted to enjoy Playa del Carmen and made the reservation with little time in advance and we only found this place at a reasonable price (95 usd/night). We arrived at night and it was difficult to find access to the hotel due to streets repairs. I was angry for this and later I was not supposed to be able to live the rented car at the hotel because they have not that service. I finally convinced the lady to live the car in their personal parking place. The best: half block away from 5th avenue (but you can sleep well without noise) and half block away from the beach. Average: rooms/facilities, food, service. Bad: no parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't long enough”
Reviews.Author: Bill T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid Jan 2012. Location - Excelent - 1/2 block from beach, 1/2 blk to 5th Ave, 1 1/2 blocks to bus depot. Hotel- quiet, clean, comfortable, well kept grounds. Breakfast included with room rate, varied daily and all were very good. Rooftop sun deck is great to stargaze and sip your favorite. Cons - Ice is not available on site nor is there an ice bucket/cooler supplied. The glasses(tumblers) are glass(a+) not plastic but are not freshly supplied each day. Tap water is not potable, but this is common in Mexico. Outlets are scarce 1, under desk with t/v plugged in(other half used for laptop) and 1 in bathroom. There is no outlet near the bed, if my wife wanted to use her heating-pad she had to lay on floor or sit up in desk chair. All considered I rate this as a 4.5 out of 5

Reviews.Title: “Friendly small hotel with a great location.”
Reviews.Author: statboy
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in October and were very pleased. The rooms were modern and comfortable, Good Mexican breakfasts were included. We loved being in close proximity to the beach and restaurants. The office staff were very professional and helpful. We will be returning in February.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: rubylew
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to everything in Playa Del Carmen. The facility is clean and secure. I had a single deluxe room and it was huge. The maid service was super and every morning they offered breakfast in the courtyard. The pool is cleaned daily and the water is cool and refreshing on a hot day. The price is very reasonable and the staff always helpful and friendly. Airconditioning worked great and was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, beautiful and safe!”
Reviews.Author: drpypes
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in June of 2001, and wished we could stay longer. Grounds are beautiful, staff was excellent, and location was perfect. We enjoyed the stay so much we are contemplating a return in the fall. This is the second time members of our party have stayed here, and the experience just keeps getting better. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good.”
Reviews.Author: CAntonioDiaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Posada Sian Kaan once again. Room 306. Loved it. Price, location, staff, ..really all goes well here. Like to have breakfast seating next to a Cenote. Will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place close to the action on 5th ave and beach but still quiet”
Reviews.Author: scubaswenson
Reviews.Content: This place is a great find. You are 1 block from the ADO terminal and half a block off of 5th ave. but the compound is quiet and peacful, you are close to the maddness but can easily get away. Great sun deck with ocen views! good value...about 65 USD per night in the old building and weak mexican breakfast. I would stay here again. Other places are cheaper like 45-50 USD, but you get so much less.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: cattlemanGH
Reviews.Content: Like other posters have said, the photos do not do this place justice. The photos posted by the hotel are very acurate of this hotel and any photo before 2009 is not because the hotel has been completely remodeled. Breakfast is now served on the property and is included. You have 2 choices each day. The hotel is half a block to the beach and about a block from the ADO bus station. The staff was very friendly and spoke English. Juan behind the front desk was especially helpfull and informative. He can recommend restaurants and can also occasionally offer you a card for a discount. Massages are available on the sundeck overlooking the ocean. The hotel was sold out during our stay but did not seem crowded. Coffee makers are available for the room for a $25 deposit. We rented the larger king with a small refrigerator and partial view of the ocean. Only negative was the elevator was broke for part of our stay. I would stay here again, hopefully in the fall!!

Reviews.Title: “my favorite place in playa del carmen”
Reviews.Author: Chicagomex
Reviews.Content: There are several hotels such as the Sian Kaan that is very clean, reasonable priced and walking distance from the beach. The hotel offers free breakfast. You must go to the local airport right down 5th avenue. My fiancee and I went on the two man airplane glider. It was a great experience and very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NJBeachgirlUSA
Reviews.Content: Good breakfast. Spent most of our daytime at the nearby beach.Small pool area could use a few more lounge chairs. Nice roof deck for watching sunset over the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: DJstories
Reviews.Content: We were there during our honey moon trip around Yucatan. We did not booked a hotel in Playa del Carmen so it was quite stressful to find one. We asked in several places – always close to the beach. All were very noisy and extremely expensive as for the standard offered. When we entered Posada Sian Kaan we knew we will stay there. The lobby is nice, the people working were extremely helpful. The rooms are quite, clean and have nice balconies. It’s not sea view, but rooms overlook a nice garden. We had a “honey mooners” surprise in the morning during breakfast, which was very nice. It is a perfect place if you want to make a trip to Cozumel as the ferry is 7 minutes walking from there. On the corner you have a nice sea food restaurant. Definitely a nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous find & good value for your $$”
Reviews.Author: kuchkid
Reviews.Content: this was my 9th trip to the area and have stayed at a lot of hotels in the area from 2 star to 5 star. This was by far the best value and overall best stay yet. Very pleasant staff, amazing location and newly renovated and clean rooms that were comparable to some of the high priced rooms in the all inclusive resorts. Although the beds were a little hard, I have to say that I have yet to find any hotel in Playa that has anything but a harder bed no matter if it is a 5 star or not. We will for sure come back and have already recommended it to friends who have also booked in for later this month. Do note this is not a place to stay if your purpose is to go to the area to party. It is nice and quiet and centrally located to everything in the heart of 5th and the beach. Luved it soo much. :) ohhh and free wifi too which was a huge bonus

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with freindly, efficient staff in an excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: Donatthelake2
Reviews.Content: Large clean rooms with marble floors. Daily maid service was excellent. Continental breakfast was served in a new palapa situated in the middle of the hotel next to the onsite cenote. The location of this hotel is perfect. The beautiful beach is 1/2 block east and 5th Ave is 1/2 block west. The bus station is one block south on 5th Ave and the ferry to Cozumel is about 3 blocks away. We stayed for 10 days and only scratched the surface of enjoying all the restaurants and entertainment within walking distance of the hotel. Breakfast was different each morning with 2 choices available. One of the choices each morning was a great fresh fruit plate with or without yogurt and granola. The other choice changed each day. One day fried eggs with ranchero sauce, one day pancakes, one day scrambled eggs with ham, one day waffles, one day french toast and others. Everyday was really good and filling. The hotel was completely full most days we were there but was never crowded. The fish shaped pool (always spotlessly clean) was usually empty. I guess the beautiful beach only 1/2 block away was too tempting. The sun deck on the roof had a great view of the beach. Most rooms look onto the pool. Rooms on the 4th floor cost more but you can see the beach. We will definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: sunshine2377
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed our stay in Posada Sian Kaan. Before we arrived in Playa I called them about 1/2 before getting there and they were very helpful over the phone, which influenced my decision to stay there. Once we arrived the rooms were better than I expected, clean, modern and nice. The hotel is in a very good location, between the beach and the famous 5th Ave. where you can find all of the shopping, restaurants and bars of the area. The hotel is walking distance from everything but not right on the 5th so it is very quiet at night. The pool is small and very nice. I was quite sick during my stay and the bed was comfortable enough for me to sleep in as if I was right at home. The do not have breakfast on site but are nice enough to include the breakfast for you at a local restaurant just 2 blocks away, the deal only includes one cup of coffee per person, so if you are anything like us when it comes to drink coffee you'll have to pay for the extra (but not a big deal, I think). Staff was very helpful and specially Jose, who treat us really well. Also, there's no parking at this hotel (like many others on the area) but it's easy to find a parking place, roughly it's about $10US a day. Overall with all the options of places to stay in Playa, I am sure that you will not do wrong if you choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Heaven”
Reviews.Author: knpr
Reviews.Content: After having a very unsettling experience with Casa Ticul, ( Even though we had a confirmed reservation at Casa Ticul, and we saw an unoccupied room at Casa Ticul, not ours. Our room had a cloged sink. We were farmed out to another "better hotel" ... NOT) We decided to find a hotel closer to the beach. We walked around downtown area our first night and looked at hotel's between 5th Avenue and the beach. Our last stop was Sian Kaan. It was exactly what both of us wanted. Beautiful quiet rooms with a fabulous interior courtyard with pool. The top floor of the hotel had the most beautiful view of the beach on one side and downtown on the other. It really was "steps from the beach", a wonderful coffee shop (The Coffee Press) across the street and an open air beach restaurant that has some the best cerviche around. Pictures to follow

Reviews.Title: “I Swear, My Best Experience in Playa del Carmen. EVER!”
Reviews.Author: RoccoMiami
Reviews.Content: What I didn't find in this hotel? Couldnt connect/charge my phone or computer next to my bed.The plug is on another wall. The rest was just fine, or even better than that. Clean, great location location, quiet, good service, simple but cute. amazing sea view from the terrace, spacious restroom, WiFi (fast), I paid $66. 00 for my room, and that included a breakfast at a restaurant located one block away right on Quinta Ave. What else? I really liked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel next to the beach, great service and affordable indeed.”
Reviews.Author: hanochr
Reviews.Content: We would like to share with you an enjoyable stay at the hotel. The rooms are designed very clean. Has a small nice pool which is a refuge from the heat. Natural spring, delicious breakfast at a local restaurant. The hotel service was amazing, courteous and professional. We take this opportunity to thank personally to Patricia Lencanda Garicia. Definitely recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: MEPSTL
Reviews.Content: We LOVED this place. Clean, friendly & helpful staff, perfect location, excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place at PDC.”
Reviews.Author: Kontje
Reviews.Content: I'm reluctant to even write this review, because I'm afraid this treasure will get too booked and too expensive if everybody finds out about it! I've stayed at Posada Sian Ka'an the last two winters and will definitely return next year. It's on Calle 2 (not 4), between 5th Ave. (La Quinta) and the beach, tucked away behind a gate, with a nice courtyard. You don't feel like you're in the middle of a bustling tourist area. The main house has a few rooms, but I've never stayed in those; I'm partial to the little cabins on the outside of the courtyard that have two rooms each (four total). I spent $40 USD/night but that price could be due to me being a repeat customer, not sure. Rooms were sparse - no AC, no TV, no phone - but you don't need any of the above. Well, I take that back, there were one or two nights where the AC would have been welcomed. It was freaking hot there this year. It's quiet there and guests are expected to be quiet, too. No pool, but you can sit or lie out in the courtyard for some sun, reading, whatever. You're in the middle of everything. It completely rocks. The only thing I struggled with was parking since I rented a car, but I eventually found a place to park down on Calle 16 between 15th and 20th Aves., if I remember correctly. The traffic can get pretty brutal at Playa these days, the growth is ridiculous, and the prices are rising. Go soon!

Reviews.Title: “It feels like home!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaSarah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Posada for two weeks and know that I couldn't have done better with my choice in hotels. I had a huge room on the second story with a partial ocean view, a king bed, and a double bed. After the first couple of days I felt like I was part of "the family". My housekeeper, Karla, was amazing. My room was sparkling everyday! There is no TV,phone or airconditioning so if you need these then this probably isn't the place for you. Who needs them when you are in paradise! They serve croissants,tea, and coffee in the morning which was something to look forward to to start your day off. The grouds were immaculate-I often found passersby taking pictures from the street through the gated courtyard. I felt so safe here, there was a security guard on at night and the gate is closed after a certain time, but guests have a key in case you make it home later. The very best part is that it is only about 200 yds(if that) from the beach on Calle 2 which is a realatively quiet street. There is a wonderful seafood resturant on the corner on the beach which is the oldest in Playa-wonderful fish that you watch the guys haul in off the boat every morning. The one and only thing that was bothersome at all was the loud Peruvian flute music at the resturant on 5th avenue which is behind some of the rooms on the second floor. Besides that Posada was wonderful-actually I am going back for seven nights at the end of March and then in May. I love it and would reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A piece of Paradise in a City”
Reviews.Author: Oudie
Reviews.Content: I stayed with some friends in the Posada Sian Kaan this summer during ten days. On my room ( Gabriella) everything was very clean, simple but very nice. No TV, no AC, no freezer, anyway for the price when I compare with other hotels, I would definitely return to there next time. You are near the Beach, the coffee shop is terrible (I love fruits cocktails ...) and the staff is very nice. An address to put on your list of places to visit, when you pass in front of the hotel, you can see a very beautiful garden like coming from nowhere !!! Enjoy your stay !!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grounds, great location”
Reviews.Author: AngelicaM
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel are basic, but clean and comfortable (except at about 4 pm on an August afternoon, when the ceiling fans don't quite counteract the heat). The courtyard is gorgeous--full of palms trees, birds, and a small, mostly dry cenote. The breakfast of croissants and coffee is simple but tasty. But best of all, you're half a block from the beach. And this is why you come to Playa del Carmen, right? Note: Posada Sian Ka'an is also known as Hotel Labnah. I had trouble finding contact info using the name Posada Sian Ka'an.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Jen61C
Reviews.Content: My 2 kids and I stayed at Sian Ka'an at the end of March and would definately go back again. Our room was on the 2nd floor and was very spacious!! We had a king size bed and a full size bed in the room and still had tons of space!! The decor was simple but clean and felt very light and airy. A very large patio had a slight view of the ocean and lots of privacy and very green. Across the cobblestone street is a very nice outdoor coffee shop with inexpensive food, we stopped in every morning for coffee, very plesant! The hotel also serves a continental breakfast which consists of coffee and croissants with jam, very nice. The location is perfect, a half of a block from the beach and a half of a block from Ave. 5, yet when you are on the grounds of the place, you feel as if you are very secluded. All in all this is a great place, and very reasonably priced, we paid only $48.00 per night!! Can't beat that ! The only drawback {according to my 17 year old son} was that there is no air conditioning or T.V. but I would highly recommend staying here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello everybody ! First of all, I have to say that Playa Del Carmen is so much better than Cancun : it is not as crowdy as Cancun and on top of that, there aren't many Americans !! :-) Posada Sian Ka'An is the perfect place if you don't want to spend all your money in a hotel room. Our room was very clean, had a ceiling fan, some clean towels, very nice double bed... The price of your room (from 27 $ to 47$) includes a breakfast with your choice of tea adn coffee and two croissants, butter and marmelade !!! All the staff is very friendly, especially the woman at the desk, named Francis. There is also a receptionist who speaks a little bit of French, which is not that common in Mexico ! I would definitely stay again at Posada Sian Ka'an if I ever come to Playa del Carmen again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice inexpensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than a block from the beach. It is across from a very nice little breakfast and coffee cafe that has a user library of books for your interest. The hotel is clean and quient. The service was very good for a small place with clean towels and beach towels and water for the guests. The beds were comfortable and in room A/C was an option. Small balconies and ceiling fans are standard. I had an off season rate in July 2003 of $30 US a night.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Posada Sian Ka'an
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 2 Norte entre 5a Av y Z.F.M., Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
